exec: pm.test(`Create ${pm.request.url.path[3]} with all fields + replicate to S4. Successful POST request`, function () {

item.description:
# Valid Scenario 1

1. Create BP with all exposed fields
> `status` gets `sent`  
2. Call Scheduled job (GET MDIClient)
> `status` gets `confirmed` with `versionId` and `keys` populated
3. Update (PUT) with all exposed fields !
> `status` gets `sent`  
4. Call Scheduled job (GET MDIClient) 
> `status` gets `confirmed` with `versionId` and `keys` updated
5. Send multiple updates (PATCH) (at least 2 consecutive updates) !
> `status` gets `sent` with `pending` set to `true`
6. Call Scheduled job (GET MDIClient) 
> `status` gets `alert` with `errorMessage` if there's an additional update event from MDI, otherwise, `confirmed`
7. Send again one of the updates (PATCH) !
> `status` gets `sent`
8. Call Scheduled job (GET MDIClient) 
> `status` gets `confirmed` with `versionId` and `keys` updated

> ! = If `@sap/cds` version is less than 5.4.4. Notes below apply:

> Note: Update payload should not have a `customerInformation.salesArrangements.functions` field 

> Note: Update payload should not remove an existing `salesArrangements` instance

item.name: 3.1 - Update BP w/ All fields (including functions)

item.description:
# Invalid Scenario 1
> Important note: Check this scenario again after `@sap/cds` upgrade to 5.4.4. This should be valid after upgrade.

1. Create BP with all exposed fields
> `status` gets `sent`  
2. Call Scheduled job (GET MDIClient)
> `status` gets `confirmed` with `versionId` and `keys` populated
3. Update (PUT) with all exposed fields (including functions)
> C4Uf update fails with `UNIQUE_CONSTRAINT_VIOLATION`, then app crashes with `SQLITE_MISUSE: Statement is already finalized`

item.description:
# Invalid Scenario 2
> Important note: Check this scenario again after `@sap/cds` upgrade to 5.4.4. This should be valid after upgrade.

1. Create BP with all exposed fields
> `status` gets `sent`  
2. Call Scheduled job (GET MDIClient)
> `status` gets `confirmed` with `versionId` and `keys` populated
3. Update (PUT) with all exposed fields (removed existing `salesArrangements` instance)
> C4Uf app crashes with `[INTERNAL ERROR] RangeError: Maximum call stack size exceeded`

item.description:
# Valid Error Scenarios 1

1. Create BP with all exposed fields
> `status` gets `sent`  
2. Create BP with missing mandatory fields 
> request rejected in C4Uf. Doesn't trigger MDI create event
3. Update BP with missing mandatory fields
> request rejected in C4Uf. Doesn't trigger MDI update event

1. Create BP (SP) with all exposed fields

> request rejected in C4Uf. Doesn't trigger MDI update event
